label: 中有
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: [T]he belief, first expounded by certain Indian Buddhists, that the individual entered a brief intermediate existence (chūu) before being reborn.  On each seventh day until the forty-ninth, it was held, the soul had a chance at rebirth, and its fate could meanwhile be influenced by the acts of the living (p. 370). [HW]
